headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Afghanistan review for a caught behind It was a back of a good length ball pitching around middle. It jagged back in slightly and cut the batter in half. Ultraedge confirms a spike when the bat is hanging next to the ribs and the Decision is overturned. Afghanistan have their first one, thanks to a beauty from Farooqi

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: Afghanistan review for an LBW that was given not out by the umpire. It is a fair delivery that was on a good length, it beat the bat, positioned to defend straight, and hit the pad around off. It's pitching in line, the impact is in line, and is hitting the stumps.Review Retained!. The point of impact was the worry there but once that was in line, it was always crashing into middle. There was a hint of inswing that helped as well

headshotImage.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim headshot

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh review an LBW. It was given out on field. The fair delivery was on a good length and hit Mushfiqur on the knee roll. The ball hit the pad first and then edged the inside edge of the bat. It was pitching in line, the impact was in line, and Hawkeye confirmed it would go on to hit the wickets. Review Lost. Farooqi and Afghanistan are well on top now.

Knocks him over! It hit a length and came back in. Beats the flick and clatters the stumps as Farooqi jumps in celebration. That ball will make the compilation videos of jaffas from left-armers anyday!

ballComments.title: Gulbadin to Afif

commentTextItems.html: The length ball outside off is pulled through mid wicket and both batters rejoice

commentPostTextItems.html: For now, I Ekanth, am signing off on behalf of my fellow commentator, Sruthi Ravindranath, and our scorer, Chandan Duorah. Take care and stay safe

Well, that brings to an end a scintillating voyage that this game turned out to be. Tamim's disbelief does echo the magnanimity of this achievement. It's one of a three match ODI series but it's one to remember. We will be back on Friday for the second ODI on Friday. If this game is anything to go by, it'll be a cracker and a potential series decided. Catch all the action from that game here

Tamim Iqbal, Bangladesh Captain: Honestly, I did not believe we could win after 45/6. But I'm very proud and happy for the two for their incredible innings. Afghanistan have a brilliant attack but Mehidy and Afif did well. Hopefully this is a start for them and they have many more amazing performances.
Mehidy Hasan is the Player of the Match for his 81* (120) and 10-3-28-0

Hasmatullah Shahidi, Afghanistan Captain: We had a good start but they played very well without giving a chance, which was incredible. We were 30-runs short but the way Fazal started was great but credit to them for fighting back. This was just the start but there are two more games to go and we will look to come back.
Saravanan: "Difficult part is choosing player of the match...can it be shared ?" We'll find out as the presentations begin.
Anwar: "Do you believe in miracles now?"
A A Musabbir : "This is incredible. I am always hopeful with Bangladeshi cricket but never believed they will win it from 45/6. Hats of Afif and Miraz. Really proud of you."

7:01 pm: The under 22 duo have done it! They strung, wove, and fabricated a partnership for more than 35 overs with 174 runs to take their side to what seemed an impossible victory. Afghanistan started the innings with a cluster of wickets in the first ten where Farooqi wrote his own script. After Rashid got Mahmudullah, it got even direr. But the last hope that came with Afif and Mehidy blossomed into belief and later, conviction. Eventually, they took the team home and made it look like they were never under any pressure to begin with.

ballComments.title: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Afif

commentTextItems.html: Length on the body, bottom edges a full-fledged pull onto the ground to short mid wicket

commentPostTextItems.html: Just four needed off the last two. It's only a matter of when the game finishes, not who wins anymore

commentTextItems.html: Length outside off, helps a cover drive through the gap. They scampered for three. Their fitness levels seem to be at par with the adrenaline levels

commentPostTextItems.html: ahmada: "I would bring on a part timer like Rahmat shah to see what happens - fast bowlers gonna be hit"

ballComments.title: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mehidy Hasan Miraz

commentTextItems.html: Good length on the stumps, defended back to the bowler

ballComments.title: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mehidy Hasan Miraz

commentTextItems.html: Wide on a length, beats the late dab

commentPostTextItems.html: Shahid: "Mehdi at its best and yes this is highest ODI score as well now."

ballComments.title: Fazalhaq Farooqi to Mehidy Hasan Miraz

commentTextItems.html: Length outside off, rides an open faced drive behind backward point

ballComments.title: Rashid Khan to Afif

commentTextItems.html: Length outside off, fine late cut to third man and Rashid is done for the day!

commentPostTextItems.html: He ends with one wicket but that was almost 35 overs ago, Bangladesh is on top!

ballComments.title: Rashid Khan to Mehidy Hasan Miraz

commentPostTextItems.html: Pramod Pandey: "Irrespective of the opponents, this should give Bangladesh Cricket a huge morale lift. Could be start of something new in Bangladeshi Cricket."

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal lbw b Fazalhaq Farooqi 8 (8b 2x4 0x6 17m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Afghanistan review for an LBW that was given not out by the umpire. It is a fair delivery that was on a good length, it beat the bat, positioned to defend straight, and hit the pad around off. It's pitching in line, the impact is in line, and is hitting the stumps.Review Retained!. The point of impact was the worry there but once that was in line, it was always crashing into middle. There was a hint of inswing that helped as well

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim lbw b Fazalhaq Farooqi 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh review an LBW. It was given out on field. The fair delivery was on a good length and hit Mushfiqur on the knee roll. The ball hit the pad first and then edged the inside edge of the bat. It was pitching in line, the impact was in line, and Hawkeye confirmed it would go on to hit the wickets. Review Lost. Farooqi and Afghanistan are well on top now.

milestones.description: Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Afif Hossain's 174-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 7th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 127 between Imrul Kayes and Saifuddin
Mujeeb has broken the record for most ducks (8) in ODIs for AFG, going past Dawlat Zadran's 7
